text: Where does i found on HubSpot. Can you guide me how to open this page please.

This will not be available within Standard HubSpot accounts.
You will need to create a Developer Account here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/get-started>
If i create an account as developer in HubSpot then how will I be able to add a contacts

you will use the app developer account to create apps (e.g. an YourWebhookApp that can subscribe to webhooks)
you will use the standard account to create contacts.

you will need to connect the app developed in your developer account (YourWebhookApp) with your standard account by using the oauth flow.. and once you have successfully connected the two apps (if you navigate to Settings > Connected apps;  in your standard account, you will see YourWebhookApp) listed there.

You can now configure YourWebhookApp to subscribe to the various events (e.g. contacts.property_changed) in your connected app(s).

more details here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks>
Thank you for the help. One last help, can you please help  me in connecting my developer account with a standard account in HubSpot
I was able to connect the account. Thank you

Hi guys, I need help. So we are using the workflows for our pipelines, that change the status of a ticket after answering (switch to "waiting for contact") or after getting an answer from our customers (switch to "open"). So its nice to have that. But the problem is, the process didn't work in the case of a customer, or we opened a new thread in the ticket. So, the workflows seem not to be triggered. We can change the way we answer, but its difficult to change the way our customer answers because maybe the contact has to forward the email to a third person, for example. Does any of you have the same problem or a solution? Or do you have information about why the system is designed like that? Because it seems to be a descision: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/tickets/customize-ticket-pipelines-and-statuses>.
